summary: The document is an agent report dated October 5, 1967, focusing on the potential sensitive desertion of Roman D. S. Arnold, a Specialist Four in the U.S. Army. It provides a detailed account of Arnold's military and personal background, including his enlistment, education, physical description, and service history. The report also mentions the lack of certain forms in Arnold's 201 file, which restricted the scope of the investigation.
key_findings: Roman D. S. Arnold was a Specialist Four in the U.S. Army with a service number RA 16 838 103.
Arnold was born on January 6, 1945, in Lindau Bodensee, Germany, and was of German citizenship.
He enlisted on October 15, 1965, and served in various units, including the 198th Infantry Brigade at Fort Hood, Texas.
The report highlights the absence of a DD Form 398 (Statement of Personal History) in Arnold's 201 file, limiting the background information available.
Arnold's military education included a 12-week Signal Corps course in 1966, and he had no record of non-judicial punishment or courts martial.
The document was classified as 'UNCLASSIFIED' and was released with deletions on March 20, 1995.
